speaker.whotheyare: Aimée Eubanks Davis believes that our next generation of leaders will emerge from everywhere.
speaker.whylisten:
Aimée Eubanks Davis is the founder and CEO of Braven which works to ensure underrepresented college students develop the skills, confidence, experiences and networks to get strong first jobs after graduation.

Davis spent the majority of her career at Teach For America. She held various senior leadership roles, including leading the organization's groundbreaking work around its human capital and diversity efforts. Earlier in her career, she taught sixth grade, led the Breakthrough/Summerbridge New Orleans site and worked for the national organization. She is a 2019 Obama Foundation Fellow, Pahara-Aspen fellow, a member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network, a Braddock Scholar, a Draper Richards Foundation Entrepreneur and a Camelback Ventures Fellow. A graduate of Mt. Holyoke College, Davis resides in Chicago with her husband and three children.
